Package com.teksystems.salestaxexercise

Class TaxableBasketImpl

java.lang.Object
com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.TaxableBasketImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Basket, Receiptable, Sellable, Taxable, TaxableBasket
public class TaxableBasketImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaxableBasket, Receiptable
Implementation of a basket of good with taxes TODO: this class shouldn't really implement Receiptable itself, there should be a separate view class for that TODO: this class is still a work in progress, only the functionality vital to producing the sample outputs for the exercise has been implemented
Author:
Andrew

    • getRegionOfSale

      public com.ibm.icu.util.Region getRegionOfSale()
      Description copied from interface: Sellable
      The same good or service can be sold for different prices in different countries or states or regions. Or might be available for sale in some regions, but not others. So we require that all sellable items or collections of items have a geographical region attached to them
      Specified by:
      getRegionOfSale in interface Sellable
      Returns:
      region in which the sale is taking place

    • getTaxJurisdictions

      public java.util.LinkedHashSet<TaxJurisdiction> getTaxJurisdictions()
      Specified by:
      getTaxJurisdictions in interface TaxableBasket
      Returns:
      the list of tax jurisdictions for this basket, cannot be null or empty

    • getTaxAmounts

      public java.util.LinkedHashMap<Tax,​org.joda.money.Money> getTaxAmounts()
      Description copied from interface: Taxable
      The SOLID design principle that interfaces should wherever possible depend on other interfaces, not concrete classes, would suggest this should return a Map, not a LinkedHashMap. However, because some taxes may be assessed on top of other taxes, maintaining the order of taxes may be very important in many implementations. I decided the benefits of forcing every implementer to implement with a structure that maintains order outweighed the potential loss in flexibility.
      Specified by:
      getTaxAmounts in interface Taxable
      Returns:
      the list of taxes and amounts for this taxable object
